thread.title: NBA community mourns Flip Saunders' death
thread.title_full: NBA community mourns Flip Saunders' death - CBSSports.com

author: James Herbert
title: NBA community mourns Flip Saunders' death
text:
Minnesota Timberwolves president and head coach Flip Saunders died, the team announced on Sunday , and there was an immediate outpouring of messages from the NBA community. As the league mourns his death, here is reaction from just a small sampling of the many people he touched: 
Flip you were one of a kind. Great basketball mind and even better human being. You had a great impact on my life personally and professionally. RIP my friend. Prayers are with the Saunders family during this time. 
A photo posted by @kevinlove onOct 25, 2015 at 11:26am PDT
I've been thinking for 30 minutes of what to say but words can't describe how special and important Coach Saunders was to me. I want to thank you coach for giving me the opportunity to play in the NBA and achieve my dream. I know the man above has a special place for you in his kingdom and this world, this league, this family will never be the same. I love you coach and I'm going to miss you so so much. 
A photo posted by Karl Towns (@karltowns) onOct 25, 2015 at 12:22pm PDT
My condolences to the Saunders and @Timberwolves family! Lost a great person in our fraternity way to early. So sad #RIPFlip 
— LeBron James (@KingJames) October 25, 2015 I am deeply saddened by the passing of Coach Flip. My condolences to his family and loved ones. #RIPFLIP pic.twitter.com/yxcJwdT0eG 
— Thad Young (@yungsmoove21) October 25, 2015 RIP Coach Flip Saunders had the opportunity & honor to be able to chop it up with such a great mind during the draft process.
— Myles Turner (@Original_Turner) October 25, 2015 We have all been blessed by your wonderful life, Coach Flip. You will be deeply missed. Rest in peace.
— shabazz muhammad (@ShabazzMuhammad) October 25, 2015 So Sad to hear of the passing of Flip Saunders. Flip was one of the best guys in the NBA. My thoughts and prayers go out to his family.
— Billy King (@bkdefend) October 25, 2015 Today, the guy who believed in me since day 1 passed away. He was all smiles passionate and really loved this game. He gave everything to the Timberwolves and did amazing things for us. He was our leader. Really gonna miss you coach. RestInPeace Flip. 
A photo posted by Ricky Rubio (@ruuufio) onOct 25, 2015 at 12:06pm PDT
Best thing about being beat writer of Flip Saunders' teams was, he couldn't stay mad at you. Always sense the FUN was bigger than grudges.
— Steve Aschburner (@AschNBA) October 25, 2015 RIP to @Flip_Saunders ... Had the pleasure to play for him and get to know him. Great coach and Person!!! My heart goes out to his family
— Baron Davis (@Baron_Davis) October 25, 2015 My prayers goes out to #coachFlipSaunders family. This was a good man and a great coach. The @Timberwolves family will miss this man.
— Corey Maggette (@Corey_Maggette) October 25, 2015 RIP @Flip_Saunders , hard to comprehend
— Daryl Morey (@dmorey) October 25, 2015 Another great one lost. RIP Flip Saunders!
— Greg Monroe (@M10OSE) October 25, 2015 The sting of losing another loved one to cancer doesn't get any easier. My thoughts & prayers are with the Saunders &Twolves family. Coach Saunders guided me into this league, he believed in me and taught me what it takes to be a good player and a better man. RIP Coach 
A photo posted by johnwall (@johnwall) onOct 25, 2015 at 11:36am PDT
Flip Saunders has died at 60 years old. (USATSI) Topics: Minnesota Timberwolves , NBA
